thread.title: Local Red Wings players visit new arena site
thread.title_full: Local Red Wings players visit new arena site

title: Local Red Wings players visit new arena site
text:
VIDEO: Michigan-born Red Wings players visit The District Detroit construction site 10:52 AM, Oct 22, 2015 Photo via Detroit Red Wings on Facebook Show Caption Previous Next 
DETROIT (WXYZ) - Five Michigan-born Red Wings players took some time out of their day last week to visit the construction site for The District Detroit and meet with construction workers. 
Luke Glendening, from Grand Rapids, Justin Abdelkader, from Muskegon, Dylan Larkin, from Waterford, Danny DeKeyser, from Detroit, and Drew Miller, who was born in New Jersey but grew up in East Lansing, were invited to check out the Detroit Events Center worksite. 
The video gives a good look at how much work has been done on the site since construction began. 
"Knowing what it's gonna be and seeing the plans and seeing what it looks like here, I think the location is great, gets the blood flowing gets you excited for an opportunity to play in the new building," Abdelkader said. 
Right now, construction is still in the structural mode which is laying concrete foundations, which will continue for months. After that, they will be erecting the structural steel. 
"The size of it, how enormous it is and the amount of work it's taken to get done is a little overwhelming if I was doing it, but I'm glad someone knows what they're doing," Glendening added. 
Check out the video below. Five Michigan-born #RedWings visited the Detroit Events Center site to check on the progress of their new home #LGRW https://t.co/UgcToFhVzj â€” Detroit Red Wings (@DetroitRedWings) October 22, 2015 Copyright 2015 Scripps Media, Inc.
